labels.text: Beginning in 2004, Liang Yuanwei typed the phrase ‘umustbestrong’ onto a roll of two-ply toilet paper forty-four times a day for an extended period of time. The painstaking and self-discplined approach adheres to the mantra ‘you must be strong’, which contrasts with the flimsy and disposable quality of the paper. It is also a comment on the condition of being a female artist in the mainstream art scene and daily life.

Liang Yuanwei typed the phrase ‘umustbestrong’ on a roll of two-ply toilet paper forty-four times a day for an extended period of time. The artist’s painstaking and disciplined approach corresponds to the mantra ‘you must be strong’, which contrasts with the flimsy and disposable paper. The work is a comment on the condition of being a female artist in the mainstream art scene and in daily life.
自2004年起，梁遠葦幾乎每天都在卷裝兩層廁紙上打上「umustbestrong」的字樣44次，維持了一段頗長時間。如此認真而嚴謹的行為，卻與廁紙薄弱易爛的特質形成反諷，呼應句中的「U must be strong」（你一定要堅強），表達她在主流藝壇和日常生活中作為女性藝術家的特殊感受。

images.AltText: A framed photograph of a portable typewriter loaded with toilet paper hangs on a wall. Beneath it, the actual roll of toilet paper is displayed in a glass case. The word ‘UMustBeStrong’ has been repeatedly typed on the roll of paper in the style of a formal dated diary.
images.AltTextTC: 牆上是一幅裝裱了相框的照片，照片裏的手提打字機裝上一卷廁紙。相框下方的玻璃箱內，正展示着那卷廁紙的實物，廁紙上標有日期，以日記形式重複打上「你必須堅強」。
